result.title: Applied Mathematicians into Programming Contests
result.content:
I have liked mathematics since I know myself as a human and now after met CodeForces 1 year ago, I love programming as well. That's why I decided to attend Applied Mathematics next year ( I'm still 16 years old :( ). What I would like to know is how much competitive programming helps in a graduation/career of an applied mathematician once I got to know GlebsHP and noticed his incredible achievements. Do the competitive programming's algorithms appears into the researchs or they don't but the importance is in the development of the logical thinking...?

Sorry for my bad English. Thanks in advance. :)
